On Sat, 17 Jul 2004 00:03:03 -0400, "J. B. Rainsberger"
<jbrains@...> said:
> 
> Vlad Roubtsov wrote:
> > On any but the trivial projects the number of
> > testcases quickly exceeds 100-200+. It usually takes a
> > noticeable time to run them all.
> Can you quantify this? GSBase, for example, runs tests at
> approximately
> 100/second, and that's my usual performance goal for tests. On
> my most
> recent project, I separated tests that required expensive,
> external
> resources (there were about 10) from tests than ran entirely in
> memory
> (there were about 400). The in-memory tests ran in about 6
> seconds.

I will add that on my last project we had 2000+ /unit/ tests that ran in
20 - 30 seconds.  Our functional tests (over 30) at one point were
running in 17 minutes.  With 1.5 days of refactoring the functional
tests they ran in 3 - 5 minutes.

If you are keeping count that is 2030+ tests within 5 minutes, an
average of 406 tests per minute (but let's not forget that the unit
tests ran about 4000 - 6060 per minute).  Those are not shabby numbers,
but they aren't the best either.  There was definite room for
improvement, but we found that the ROI was not high enough to bring them
down anymore.
